headline: One-Skillet Mexican Quinoa
description: This Mexican quinoa dish with black beans, fire-roasted tomatoes, corn, and avocado is easy to make in one skillet for a family-friendly meal.

video.description: One skillet meal full of Mexican-inspired ingredients and flavors.
video.name: One Skillet Mexican Quinoa

name: One-Skillet Mexican Quinoa
recipeIngredient: 1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained
1 tablespoon red pepper flakes, or to taste
kosher salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 medium avocado - peeled, pitted, and diced

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Sauté jalapeño pepper and garlic in the hot oil until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Stir black beans, tomatoes, corn, quinoa, and chicken broth into the skillet. Season with pepper flakes, chili powder, cumin, salt, and black pepper; bring to a boil.
Cover the skillet with a lid, reduce heat to low, and simmer until quinoa is tender and liquid is mostly absorbed, about 20 minutes.
Add avocado, lime juice, and cilantro; stir until combined.

review.reviewBody: Delicious and easy! I skipped the jalapeños and pepper flakes and added a little cayenne pepper instead for my kids. We all loved it.

Reading all the comments about the red pepper flakes, I decided to skip them as my husband doesn't like food too hot. Good choice for us. 1 tsp chili powder and 1/2 tsp cumin was perfect for our taste. Also, I used a can of Del Monte Mexican tomatoes with Hatch Green chilies so which added some heat vs red pepper flakes.
Couldn't find fire roasted tomatoes. Used chopped tomatoes with jalapeno and habanero delmonte. So good!

First time through I used cayenne pepper instead of red pepper flakes, and I may have increased the amount. Really good, but REALLY hot. My teenager son really enjoyed it. 2nd attempt I cut the cayenne back to about 1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon. Perfect.
Added shredded chicken. More tomatoes.

Overall, a tasty dish with minimal clean-up. I’m a spice lover, so I doubled the red pepper flakes. The first day I could taste the lime; second day, not so much. It was also dryer the second day, so topped it with a little salsa.

This was good although I wish I had remembered to rinse off my quinoa. Was a little bitter because I did not. I used 1 tsp red pepper flakes and it was plenty spicy. I think 1 TBLSP would have been way too much.
use rice- Thorne doesn't like quinoa, cayanne pepper powder 1 1/2 tsp instead of red pepper flakes.
Very easy and quick to make. I forgot about the avocado, cilantro and lime juice, and didn't miss them.
Didn't have cilantro. Cilantro always makes things better. Will make again.
The flavor was good, but the quinoa to veggies ratio was too high.

I've struggled to find quinoa recipes that I like, so I'm happy to say this was delicious! I did leave out the chili powder and used tamed jalapenos to tone down the spice level. I'll be making this again.
We make this one often

Only used 1/4 tsp hot pepper flakes as we are whimps!! 

Served in a bowl over salad to make one dish meal.

Delicious, and loved how quick and easy it was to put together. Omitted cilantro (family member won't eat it) and cut down on the red pepper flakes, but otherwise followed recipe. I will make this again and again - thank you!

Very easy recipe. My husband and I both really liked it. I only made changes based on what I have in my pantry. So I changed out black beans for chili beans, I changed out homemade tomato sauce for fire roasted sauce, and I used chicken concentrate and water for the chicken broth. Adjust the seasonings to our likings. Didn’t have avocado so he served with a side of sour cream. Very tasty!

Didn’t have corn and used fresh tomatoes instead of canned + coconut oil spray and Canadian quinoa. 

Overall had to use a lot more broth than suggested and added chipotle peppers (canned and seasoning). Loved this dish and would make again. Came out spicer than I’d intended but I do love spice. Also added a fried egg on top

Was a great starter for a complete meal in one. Added ground chicken, tomato sauce & little vegetable juice--to make it more of a saucy kinda thing. Had to adjust seasoning a little bcuz added more liquid but was a great beginner!!
Thank you for recipe!
Very easy to make and delicious. I added less hot pepper flakes than called for in the recipe and added a dollop of sour cream to cut the heat.
We’ve been making this for over a year and love it!

So I decided to try this recipe. After all, Mexican food is usually robust and full of flavor and I must say, I will be making this again. I used every last ingredient on this list with exact measurements without reading the reviews. I started cooking it and as I waited for it to cook I decided to look through the reviews. To my surprise, I found that many people left out the jalapeno pepper and cut back on the crushed red pepper or chili powder etc, in fear that it would be too spicy. This made me very concerned being as how I added the exact measurements for all of the ingredients listed. I was worried that it may be too spicy and my family and I would not be able to eat this. While it was cooking I decided to give it a taste. It was definitely spicy. I felt the tingling in my throat and immediately went for the water. However, once the entire meal was cooked I served everyone with warning and we began to eat slowly at first. This was a shocker. It was not that spicy at all. It was just right. Even my picky eating daughter ate it all up. It was definitely good and knowing it was all healthy and natural made it a winner. I will use the leftovers as stuffing for tacos tomorrow and the next time that I make this I may also use one of the reviewers suggestions and add shrimp to it. Sounds good to me. 
Tried to add pictures but they are too big to load.
I made the recipe exactly as is and served it with marinated chicken breasts and no one really liked it. This was so bland. It’s really easy to make but it needs more salt or flavor.

I made this just as the recipe said and it was fantastic! Thumbs up on this dish! One thing I did that the instructions didn’t mention was I took the lime juice and pored it over the diced avocado before I added it to the dish, so it would stay nice and green.
Loved it! So easy! I thought it might be too spicy/hot for me, so I only used 1/2 Tablespoon of Red Pepper. I topped with a little bit of shredded cheese. It was just the right amount of kick.
We liked it a lot.
Great recipe. Topped with feta cheese since avocados are seasonal here on the east coast.

Nice change of pace with the quinoa. Yes, I add some seasoned ground beef on top for my meat loving family. A fried egg would have worked too for some added protein and richness. I have shared the recipe and will be making this again.
I'm trying to eat healthier which is what attracted me to this recipe. I really enjoyed it. I made one unintentional change, I forget avocados when I did my shopping. I will add next time,
Was a bit on the spicy side for someone that doesn’t do a lot of spicy food. I added shredded chicken to it 5 minutes before it was done and some sour cream on top. Will definitely make again.
Not a ton of flavor. It was okay. Won't make again.
Fantastic recipe! Loved the spice level, especially since we topped our quinoa with a pound of pan-seared shrimp. No other changes to the recipe. We made it last week, and will again, tonight!

I really liked this dish! I added some ground beef and since I wanted to use a whole (2-cup) can of chicken broth, I added an extra 1/2 cup of quinoa. The quinoa could've stood to simmer for a little while longer, but it wasn't too crunchy to eat. I added a bit more jalepeno then it called for, so I reduced the red pepper flakes to 1 tsp. I did add extra chili powder and cumin to boost the flavor. I thought it tasted great with some cheese and avocado on top.
Easy & Excellent! I will make this again!
So delicious, easy and flavorful!!
This was delicious made as written! A couple of big scoops onto a big bed of romaine with some ranch dressing for a delicious spicy salad. Yummy with a side of garlic toast.

I used a little cayenne instead of red pepper flakes and did not include the seeds of the jalapeño. For us, the “hotness” of it was right on the mark. 
I served with a salsa, chips, a salad and green beans for a very nice meal.
Fast! Easy! Delicious!
Very flavorful...I didn’t have black beans so I used red kidney beans and vegetable broth. I will make this recipe again was fast and easy to prepare during the busy work week
Super easy to make and absolutely delicious! It’s a definite keeper in my family’s recipes of keepers.
Yum yummy! Easy and quick!

I really liked this, my husband not as much but he is not a big fan of Mexican food (crazy I know!).
I didn't have fire roasted tomatoes so I just used a can of regular diced. Did not add red pepper flakes because I knew with just the jalapeno it would be spicy. I did sprinkle some cayenne pepper in it so with those 2 it was spicy enough. I only used 3/4 cup of quinoa which was plenty. Oh and like someone else suggested, I put in some shrimp, my husband didn't think it went well with the dish but I did .
I would definitely make this again.

Very good and easy recipe that can be easily modifed to your taste. I used a bag of frozen honey-roasted corn with peppers (steamed in the bag) and deleted the cilantro. I took other's advice and reduced the red pepper flakes. I topped this with some left-over rotisserie chicken and chopped green onions.
Was pretty good.
next time I will add an extra avocado. It got lost in the mix.
This was some of the best tasting vegetarian meals I have ever made. This is worth trying. I have made it twice now.

Needs a little something I only used 1tsp of Chile powder a few red pepper flakes and a whole roasted green Chile. Otherwise I was true to recipe. Sliced avacado and chopped cilantro on top. Next time I will add some shrimp cooked in the side or sweet potatoes. It was super fast and really 1 skillet I had all the ingredients handy and it was quick. I am a very inexperienced cook
this is just great really loved how easy it is to make and the wonderful taste
Amazing. Made exactly as the recipe suggested. Will definitely be making this again
Very easy to put together and tastes good. I only used 1 t of chili powder for our taste. Thank you.
I would make this again because it's so easy and also easy to adjust for personal preferences.
I LOVE interesting quinoa recipes, and this one is amazing! Served it with may chicken thighs, and it was a total hit! I made it EXACTLY as the recipe described.

I made this dish according to the recipe except for the crushed red pepper which I halved according to the video. When I make this again I will increase the crushed red pepper )we do live in Arizona, don't you know). The only other change was adding shredded chicken which I will also do again! Served with a dollop of sour cream. Fabulous, healthy and lots of fiber!
This is a keeper! Family loved it! Went a little light on the spice and it was excellent
I added yellow squash and zucchini, onions, used millet with red quinoa, sprinkled Tajin on it, and wrapped it in flour tortilla. Great recipe base!
Our first try with Quinoa, and it was quite good.
Just the right amount of spiciness!
Just the right amount of spiciness!

I made this with tri-colored quinoa and once cooked I chilled mine in the frig and then added lime juice, doubled the avocados and more fresh cilantro...yummy!

I have made it twice in the last week and everyone loved it! I think its even better served chilled versus warm but either way you can't go wrong!

Wow this was CRAZY spicy. My kids and I couldn’t even eat it. What a shame to waste all these ingredients. A tablespoon of red pepper makes this inedible. I understand they wrote “or to taste” but I’m going off of the original recipe calling for a tablespoon and noone would eat this. Really disappointed because I’m sure this had potential but I wouldn’t know-my mouth is still on fire.
I left out the red pepper flakes and it was still plenty "warm"

My husband and I love this easy to make dish! At step 3, I put 2 tilapia fillets or loins seasoned with salt & pepper on top and everything comes out perfect. Its a great way to include quinoa (and fish) into our diet.
Really good but a little too much jalapeño if your making for a hot sensitive group. If you like it hot, then keep the whole jalapeño, easy adjustment. Makes a lot!

The Quinoa after 20 mins was still too crunchy and as written it calls for way too much lime juice, unfortunately it was all you could taste. I will remake at a later date with additional changes to the cooking time and also only add 1/2 a lime and some onion. 

I did make a change to the submitted recipe, I only added 1 tsp of red pepper flakes as suggested and the heat of the dish was perfect for us. We do appreciate spicy food but as written, 1 Tbsp of red pepper flakes would have been way too hot
It was easy and a nice side dish, I toned it down by leaving out the jalapeño peppers.
I made this several times. I love it!
I miss the avocado because I didn’t have it, but it is very easy to prepare and very tasty!!!
Amazing! And healthy can’t do better for a 30 minute dinner and easy to pack up and take to work for lunch the next day!
I add twice the cumin and chili powder. I often use Rotel tomatoes instead of regular canned, diced tomatoes.

I made this with white rice since I didn't know I had NO quinoa in the house. I have to say, this is delicious; spicy, lots of crunch and just good flavor. I am positive it would be just as good with the quinoa. I can't wait to make it again.

This was great and tonight I'm making it for the 2nd time. I also added some frozen sweet potatoes and dialed back on the spices --about a teaspoon red pepper flakes . Since I am out of jalapeno, tonight I am using some poblano pepper instead. I took the advice of others and served with some shredded cheddar too and served with tortilla chips for dipping. A good "Meatless Monday" dinner if made with veggie broth!
Very delicious!!!

Enjoyed the spiciness and the tang of lime juice and cilantro. Used 1/2 tsp chili flakes and one 10oz can fire roasted tomatoes and green chilies. Made the mistake of not having quinoa so had to quickly substitute cooked rice. Omitted the water and added shrimp. Baked in oven for 30 min until heated through. Enjoyed this very much.
Excellent flavour and very filling.
I've made it 5 times already and I'm liking it without the corn, it's not only healthy but its delicious. Quick, simple, and easy.

This is an easy recipe to put together for a quick lunch or dinner. It was even more quick because I had cooked quinoa in my fridge. So I cut way back on the chicken broth . I didn't have the type of tomatoes called for in the recipe so I used salsa instead and I didn't use a whole can of black beans or corn. ( I made it for 2 of us ) Obviously this is a recipe that can be tweaked to your family's likings. My husband thought it had too much lime zing. We juiced about 3/4 of a small lime. I will definitely make this again.
I used 2 bullion cubes to 1 1/4 water. Left out the avacado and served with shredded mexican cheese and sour cream. I didn't add that much chili powder. Delicious!
Added just a little diced onion. I guess my pepper was really hot, because it was a little too hot, and I like spice! Good though.
Very good recipe. I will add 2 cans of black beans the next time I make it.
Everyone (husband and children) loved it! Too bad I didn’t make enough for extras! Will def make again.

I made this with vegetable broth and added frozen cubed butternut squash and sliced red, green and orange peppers (1cup total). It was quick to make and quite delicious. I doubled the recipe to share with friends.
Delicious!

Absolutely delicious, made the following changes : reduced red pepper flakes to one tsp., and added one pound of browned ground turkey lightly seasoned with taco seasoning, topped with avocado in the skillet after mixing in turkey. Served with shredded cheddar cheese and nonfat plain Greek yogurt. My husband and daughter and I finished in two days, leftovers for lunch. Will definitely make again!
Thank for sharing this recipe, my husband loves it!
Followed recipe exactly, and added sautéed shrimp at the end. Quick, easy, and tasty! I’ll be making this again.
Made as directed but added chicken that I marinated and cooked prior. This recipe is absolutely KILLER! Healthy, yummy goodness.

I made this exactly as the recipe said and all four of my family members did not like it. I will give it a clap for being easy and quick. I just did not care for the tatse of it. Also, tossing in the avacado at the end and having it slightly warm was a miss. Reviews said very flavourful but my family all said it wasn't great.
This was an easy good meal. I’ll definitely keep in my favorites
Fast easy and good .... good taco filling
I made this recipe with no changes and it was delicious! My very fussy granddaughter loved it and it is her school lunch probably three times a week. Highly recommended.

This is a simple, easy-to-make, and yummy dish that will appeal to the whole family. I wasn't even looking for it specifically on AllRecipes. I was bored one day and just picked the first recipe that popped up. Everyone who says that it packs a bit of a punch is right, but that's easy to adjust. I like spice, but I still used only 1 teaspoon of red pepper flakes instead of a tablespoon, which still left a bit of a punch. I also removed the seeds from the jalapeño and added the spices in earlier, when the jalapeño and garlic were almost ready, so that the fragrances and flavors could better meld. Just saute for a minute or under to release the essences. We added lots more lime and cilantro at the end! Even my husband, who loves very spicy, complex foods, really enjoy this. It's now in our monthly rotation!
I did not add the seeds from the jalapeño and reduced the amount of red pepper flakes. It was definitely spicy enough. Also, I added some Feta Cheese on top! Excellent dish
Delicious, delicious, delicious!!
Really quite tasty. I added shrimp after that I sautéed. Also cut back on red pepper flakes by half. Will make again, maybe with chicken.

Made this last week! Absolutely delicious, I will definitely be making this again! I added quite a bit more garlic than called for (can never have too much) only used 1 tsp. of the red chilli flakes and upped the chilli powder to 2 Tbsp. The whole family loved it!
Was excellent
I was not sure how I would like this, but it was great. I only put a small amount of Jalapeno. It is filling and if you have any issues with carbs, this one is slow reacting and healthy.
Very much enjoyed it but I did not make it spicy enough for my taste. I reduced the red pepper and Chili powder by 50 % based on some other reviews.

This was a great recipe. I actually added a whole can of chicken broth and some fajita grilled chicken. I served it over crunched multigrain Tostitos with a dollop of sour cream. I was a little worried that my hubby wouldn’t care for it and he’s eating his second bowl! It was a hit and I will make it again!

Did not make any changes, dont fix it if it ain't
 broke, perfect and very tasty
